result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel R. Anderson was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.   Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
** Pay fine of $ 2400.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).  
** Pay DNA surcharges.    Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  Report living situation to agent as well as Child Support Agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber and Work Crew allowed.  Not eligible for the electronic leg monitor. Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R. Anderson

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
Probation is extended for 2 years from 3/17/18 to 3/17/20 (copy forwarded to parties)
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
received from Agent Deschner

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Faxed copy of JOC over to the jail,  deft has to report to KCJ at 5.  E-mailed Janice B
For Cts 2, 3, & 4 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Daniel R. Anderson, appeared. Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 7 months in the KCJ commencing at 5PM today.  Huber & Work Crew authorized, but DE is not eligible for the electronic leg monitor.    Court imposes a fine of $2400 plus costs & surcharge and Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.  Balance to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights given.

208pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Continued Posted $750  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  REFUND BALANCE.
